summary: This document contains alerts from Deutsche Bank regarding Jeffrey Epstein, highlighting his status as a registered sex offender and detailing various legal issues and convictions related to sexual offenses and fraud. It includes multiple addresses associated with Epstein and mentions his criminal history, including convictions for soliciting prostitution and sexual assault of minors. This document contains a series of alerts from Deutsche Bank regarding Jeffrey Epstein, highlighting various media articles that mention him and his connections to other individuals, particularly Prince Andrew. The alerts indicate a critical risk priority associated with Epstein, detailing multiple lawsuits and allegations against him, including sexual abuse and connections to underage girls. This document contains alerts from Deutsche Bank regarding Jeffrey Epstein, highlighting various media articles related to his legal issues, financial disputes, and ongoing lawsuits. It indicates a critical risk priority for Epstein and references multiple instances of legal actions and media coverage surrounding him.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is identified as a registered sex offender with a history of sexual offenses, including soliciting prostitution and sexual assault of minors. He has multiple addresses listed and has been involved in numerous legal issues.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Prince Andrew is mentioned in relation to his friendship with Jeffrey Epstein and the controversies surrounding it.

connections.description: Prince Andrew's friendship with Jeffrey Epstein is highlighted, raising concerns about his reputation due to Epstein's criminal activities.

events.title: Conviction for Soliciting Prostitution
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was convicted of soliciting prostitution and began serving an 18-month sentence.

events.title: Served Jail Time
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein served 12 months for a state charge of prostitution solicitation and registered as a sex offender.

events.title: Initial Complaint
events.description: A woman contacted Palm Beach police regarding Epstein sexually assaulting her 14-year-old daughter.

events.title: Out-of-Court Settlements
events.description: As of May 2013, Epstein had made 17 out-of-court settlements related to allegations of sexual assault.

events.title: Deutsche Bank Monitoring Alert
events.description: Deutsche Bank issued an alert regarding Jeffrey Epstein, indicating a critical risk priority due to ongoing media coverage and legal issues.

events.title: Epstein Pleads Guilty
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pleads guilty to prostitution charges involving minors, leading to significant media coverage and legal ramifications.

events.title: Epstein's Non-Prosecution Agreement
events.description: Details of Epstein's non-prosecution agreement are discussed, revealing the leniency he received in exchange for cooperation.

events.title: FINRA Disciplinary Action
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was suspended from association with any FINRA member for 10 business days due to exercising discretion in a customer's account without proper authorization.

locations: 9 E 71ST ST, NEW YORK, New York, 10021, UNITED STATES
LITTLE ST JAMES, 6100 RED HOOK QUARTER, ST THOMAS, Virgin Islands, 00802, UNITED STATES

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is a registered sex offender since 2008.
He was convicted in 2008 for soliciting prostitution and served an 18-month sentence.
By 2011, 40 underage girls had come forward with allegations of sexual assault against Epstein.
Epstein has made 17 out-of-court settlements as of May 2013.
He has multiple addresses listed, including properties in New York, Florida, and the Virgin Islands.
Jeffrey Epstein is under critical monitoring by Deutsche Bank due to multiple allegations of sexual abuse and trafficking.
Prince Andrew's association with Epstein is causing significant reputational damage amid ongoing media scrutiny.
Epstein has faced numerous lawsuits, including claims of sexual abuse from multiple victims.
The document references a non-prosecution agreement that Epstein secured, which has been a point of contention in legal discussions.
Media articles cited in the document highlight the ongoing public and legal interest in Epstein's activities and connections.
Jeffrey Epstein is monitored by Deutsche Bank due to critical risk factors.
Multiple media articles are referenced regarding Epstein's legal disputes and financial issues.
Epstein was involved in a FINRA disciplinary action in 2012 for unauthorized account management.
There are ongoing lawsuits against Epstein, including disputes over legal fees amounting to $2 million.
Epstein's wealth and financial dealings continue to be a significant issue in the media.
